concept.title: The two-bounce rule
concept.shortdesc: A large difference between pickleball and other racquet sports lies in just two simple bounces.

conbody.p: When the ball is served, the receiving team must let it bounce in their court before returning the serve.
The serving team must then let the ball bounce in their own court.

p.b: Only after the ball has bounced once in each court is it legal to volley. Otherwise, it's a fault.
